title: Ahmed Mohamoud
text: Experienced GIS/Data professional with seven years in humanitarian roles, proficient in ArcGIS Pro, QGIS, R, Python, Power BI, Tableau, Excel, SPSS, Adobe Suite, and Kobo. Proficient in research design, data collection, analysis, interpretations, and visualization. Consistently deriving actionable insights from complex datasets for enhanced decision-making. Specialized in IPC, CARI, CADRE and FEWSNET.

title: Ahmed Mohamoud

University of California, San Diego | San Diego, CA PhD in Mathematics | Sept 2011 - June 2015
Amoud University, Somaliland | Hargeisa, Somaliland MSc in Research, Statistics & Data Analytics | Sept 2019 - Aug 2024

title: Cleaning Food Security Indicators
text: This guide is designed to assist the WFP team in cleaning food security and livelihood data using the cleanR package. Our goal is to streamline the data cleaning process, ensuring consistency with the WFP Survey Designer for standardized variable naming.

title: Cleaning Food Security Indicators
text:
Step 1: Load data
Start by uploading the raw data, typically the version downloaded from the MoDa server. Ensure that the data structure aligns with the WFP Survey Designer for consistent variable naming.

# required packages
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.2     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.1     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(DT)
library(cleanR)

# load raw data
moda_data <- cleanR::survey_data %>% # converting HDDS variables to numeric
  mutate(across(starts_with("HDDS"), as.numeric))
